name: places/ChIJn_7kyQJZwokR2n6V6vnOVeM
adrFormatAddress: 930 5th Ave #1e, New York, NY 10021-2651, USA

originalText.text: Last week Dr. Teter treated me for my foot pain. He was very professional and made me feel so comfortable. He performed a small procedure and a few days later I was all healed and back on my feet! I highly HIGHLY recommend him!

text.text: Last week Dr. Teter treated me for my foot pain. He was very professional and made me feel so comfortable. He performed a small procedure and a few days later I was all healed and back on my feet! I highly HIGHLY recommend him!

originalText.text: I don’t usually leave review but Dr. Teter is a great doctor! The custom orthotics that he fitted me is a life changer! He also suggested many shoes that fits with my lifestyle and needs. I highly recommend Dr. Teter!

text.text: I don’t usually leave review but Dr. Teter is a great doctor! The custom orthotics that he fitted me is a life changer! He also suggested many shoes that fits with my lifestyle and needs. I highly recommend Dr. Teter!

originalText.text: Dr. Teter was very professional and knowledgeable. I highly recommend him if you are looking for a podiatrist in Manhattan. During all my appointments he took the time to answer all my questions throughly

text.text: Dr. Teter was very professional and knowledgeable. I highly recommend him if you are looking for a podiatrist in Manhattan. During all my appointments he took the time to answer all my questions throughly

originalText.text: Waited over 1 hour and 20 minutes and then finally had to leave. No apologies, nothing. Also, while I was waiting in an exam room, a different podiatrist came in to clean off another patient's old orthotic insole with some strong smelling chemicals, and then a nurse came in to do the same with the other insole. Just like a foot or two from the exam table where I was sitting. I felt like I was sitting in a janitor's closet.

text.text: Waited over 1 hour and 20 minutes and then finally had to leave. No apologies, nothing. Also, while I was waiting in an exam room, a different podiatrist came in to clean off another patient's old orthotic insole with some strong smelling chemicals, and then a nurse came in to do the same with the other insole. Just like a foot or two from the exam table where I was sitting. I felt like I was sitting in a janitor's closet.

originalText.text: I came in with what turned out to be plantar fasciitis. Dr. Teter showed me some exercises, gave me some great treatments, and got me ready for my race in the fall! Amazing staff as well - they were super friendly and very helpful!
